alert.note: Alert for Washington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued February 03 at 2:41PM CST until February 03 at 3:45PM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM CST FOR SOUTHEASTERN WASHINGTON COUNTY... At 241 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles northeast of Deer Park, or 10 miles north of Citronelle, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Deer Park and Tibbie. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CST for southwestern Alabama. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
